title: The Mill in Winter: a Sketch
provenance_text:
John Henry Twachtman [1853-1902], until August 1902; estate of John Henry Twachtman, August 1902 until March 1903; John H. Twachtman sale, American Art Galleries, New York, NY, March 24, 1903, no. 70 [1]; E. A. Rorke [2]; Silas S. Dustin [1855-1940], by April 1913; gift of Andrew Carnegie to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1913 [3]. 

Notes:
[1]. See correspondence with J. Douglas Hale, dated 1955-1983, in curatorial file. 
[2]. Likely the American artist Edward A. Rorke [1856-1905], who was active in New York, NY (lived in Brooklyn Heights.) The work was purchased from the Twachtman estate sale for $150.
[3]. The painting was a gift of Andrew Carnegie to Carnegie Institute. It was delivered directly from Silas S. Dustin to the museum and accessioned on April 17, 1913.
